articles.headline: With Few New Clotting Cases, Johnson & Johnson Pause Could Be Lifted Soon
articles.snippet: Top federal health officials said in interviews this week that the number of rare blood clotting disorders in recipients of the Johnson & Johnson vaccine has remained small.
articles.abstract: Top federal health officials said in interviews this week that the number of rare blood clotting disorders in recipients of the Johnson & Johnson vaccine has remained small.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Federal health officials are leaning toward lifting their recommended pause on the use of Johnson & Johnson’s coronavirus vaccine after finding only a limited number of additional cases of a rare blood clotting disorder among recipients.
articles.byline: By Noah Weiland and Sharon LaFraniere

articles.headline: Ravaged by Covid, Brazil Faces a Hunger Epidemic
articles.snippet: Tens of millions of Brazilians are facing hunger or food insecurity as the country’s Covid-19 crisis drags on, killing thousands of people every day.
articles.abstract: Tens of millions of Brazilians are facing hunger or food insecurity as the country’s Covid-19 crisis drags on, killing thousands of people every day.
articles.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO — Rail-thin teenagers hold placards at traffic stops with the word for hunger — fome — in large print. Children, many of whom have been out of school for over a year, beg for food outside supermarkets and restaurants. Entire families huddle in flimsy encampments on sidewalks, asking for baby formula, crackers, anything.
articles.byline: By Ernesto Londoño, Flávia Milhorance and Victor Moriyama

articles.headline: U.K. Far Right, Lifted by Trump, Now Turns to Russia
articles.snippet: The anti-Islam agitator Tommy Robinson struck gold in America. Keeping it might require help from Moscow, where other British far-right activists are also finding friends.
articles.abstract: The anti-Islam agitator Tommy Robinson struck gold in America. Keeping it might require help from Moscow, where other British far-right activists are also finding friends.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Two days after supporters of former President Donald J. Trump stormed the U.S. Capitol, but failed to reverse his election defeat, a defiant shout sounded from across the ocean. Tommy Robinson, Britain’s loudest amplifier of anti-Islam, far-right anger, insisted the fight was not over.
articles.byline: By Jane Bradley and Michael Schwirtz

articles.headline: A Tiny Part’s Big Ripple: Global Chip Shortage Hobbles the Auto Industry
articles.snippet: Almost every carmaker has had to curtail production, hampering the economic recovery.
articles.abstract: Almost every carmaker has had to curtail production, hampering the economic recovery.
articles.lead_paragraph: Around the world, auto assembly lines are going quiet, workers are idle and dealership parking lots are looking bare.
articles.byline: By Jack Ewing and Neal E. Boudette
